questions.question: ............................... cold it is!
questions.description: We use 'how' before an adjective and 'what' before an adjective + noun.

questions.question: .............................. lovely weather!
questions.description: We use 'how' before an adjective and 'what' before an adjective + noun.

questions.question: How beautifully ..............................!
questions.description: Note the pattern: how + adjective/adverb + subject + verb

questions.question: ............................ pleasant surprise!
questions.description: We use 'What a/an' before adjective + singular countable noun.

questions.question: What a beautiful smile ................................!
questions.description: In exclamations the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: You talk ............................. rubbish!
questions.description: 'Such' is used before an uncountable noun. 'Such a' is used before a countable noun.

questions.question: She is .................................. beautiful!
questions.description: So is used before an adjective. Such is used before a noun or adjective + noun.

questions.question: She is .............................. kind woman!
questions.description: Use such a before a singular countable noun.

questions.question: ............................... shameful defeat!
questions.description: Use 'what a' before a singular noun or adjective + singular noun.

questions.question: He is ............................. clever boy!
questions.description: Use 'such a' before adjective + singular countable noun.

questions.question: ................................ big city Tokyo is!
questions.description: We use 'what a' before adjective + singular countable noun.
